trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.ItemCommand"></xref> event of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List"></xref> control.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs"></xref> class using the provided <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.ListItem"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The `item` and `commandSource` parameters initialize the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.ListItem%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> properties with their respective values.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.ListItem"></xref> property.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource"></xref> property.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs"></xref> class using the given <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.ListItem"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource"></xref>, and the original command arguments.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This constructor builds a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs> object.

The `item` and `commandSource` parameters initialize the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.ListItem%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource%2A> properties with their respective values.

This constructor includes an `originalArgs` parameter; this form of the constructor allows you to pass in a set of command arguments through the `originalArgs` parameter, which is useful for handling bubbled events.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.ListItem"></xref> property.
Initializes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.CommandSource"></xref> property.
The original arguments inherited from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CommandEventArgs"></xref> object.
Returns the control that raised the event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The control that raised the event.
Sets or returns the name of the default command.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
When set, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> attempts to render a shortcut to invoke the default command.
In HTML, the default rendering in `ListView` displays the first field as a link to the `DetailsView` of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList>.
By setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.DefaultCommand%2A> property, clicking the link invokes the default command.
Invoking the default command raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.ItemCommand> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CommandName%2A> of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectListCommandEventArgs> object is set to the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ListCommandEventArgs.DefaultCommand> property.
Even if a default command is defined, you should include a command with the same name in the commands collection.

If the control cannot render a graphical element that includes a shortcut for the default command, the default command is still available by rendering the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList.Commands%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection.
Returns the list item that generated the event.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The list item that generated the event.
